s.text: The distance matrix was obtained using Protdist with a Dayhoff Pam matrix.
Table 1illustrates the data used to compare the Xylella trpR gene and the Xylella genome.

Using the aminoacyl-tRNA synthases as an example of the modular-type entities asserted to be most amenable to LGT, Woese concludes that the genealogical trace of vertical gene flow is readable, despite a significant jumbling influence of LGT.

Using the aminoacyl-tRNA synthases as an example of the modular-type entities asserted to be most amenable to LGT, Woese concludes that the genealogical trace of vertical gene flow is readable, despite a significant jumbling influence of LGT.

Using the aminoacyl-tRNA synthases as an example of the modular-type entities asserted to be most amenable to LGT, Woese concludes that the genealogical trace of vertical gene flow is readable, despite a significant jumbling influence of LGT.

All the redundant genes exhibited identity relationships that suggested their origin by one or more gene-duplication events in the common ancestor of Anabaena and Nostoc ; that is, exactly as diagrammed in Figure 3.

Figure 3shows an evolutionary scenario, using a Fitch diagram [ 29], that depicts the suggested origin of trpD paralogs via two gene duplication events (Dp1 and Dp2) that preceded the node of speciation divergence (Sp4) to Nostoc (Npu) and Anabaena (Asp).
According to the foregoing rationale, isolated genes that participate in multi-step processes would not generally be expected to have much success in LGT.
According to the foregoing rationale, isolated genes that participate in multi-step processes would not generally be expected to have much success in LGT.

A 3:1 dinucleotide bias (third nucleotide position in a codon analysis algorithm followed by the first nucleotide position in the succeeding codon) was utilized, as it is the dinucleotide that is least restricted by amino-acid preference and codon usage in individual genes [ 31].

A 3:1 dinucleotide bias (third nucleotide position in a codon analysis algorithm followed by the first nucleotide position in the succeeding codon) was utilized, as it is the dinucleotide that is least restricted by amino-acid preference and codon usage in individual genes [ 31].
This might suggest an alternative to LGT, namely that there has been extreme sequence convergence because of strong selection for appropriate residues mediating domain-domain interactions.
